metadata.titel_preek: Talking and Walking with an Open Ear

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God acts faithfully in history (memory) and is petitioned to act again (hope), while the believer responds through testimony and obedience.

tekstueel_bewijs: He drew me up from the desolate pit
He put a new song in my mouth
God is a free agent who in freedom cares intensely for us

ontvanger.identificatie: The Psalmist / The Church / The Vulnerable

tekstueel_bewijs: you have given me an open ear
Our ears are made ready and able to hear when addressed by God
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that becomes internal capacity

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is both the existential 'pit' (death/despair) and the systemic 'world' that comes unglued.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response of 'Talk' and 'Walk' (Testimony and Ethics).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly framed as what happens 'between' the primary acts of God.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Open Ear → God → The Pit/Miry Bog

voorbeelden_god_subject: He set my feet upon a rock
God's work goes on in the world
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I have told the glad news
We do not want to hear

voorbeelden: I delight to do your will
you have given me an open ear
made ready and able to hear

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that the ability to hear and respond (Pouvoir) is a gift from God, not a natural human capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Memory of the Pit) to S1 (God's Fidelity), then addressing ~S1 (Closed ears/Ideology) to move toward ~S2 (The response of the Open Ear).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in God's 'wondrous deeds' which are inexplicable and beyond human explanation.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'miry bog' is treated as a real, inescapable state without divine intervention.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon maintains God as the primary actor of salvation. Human action is framed as a 'delightful' consequence of a divinely granted 'open ear.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The Psalmist fills in that gap that is the business of our lives.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He drew me up... and set my feet upon a rock.
you have given me an open ear... ears are made ready and able to hear when addressed by God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Psalmist is used as a witness to God's action rather than a hero to be imitated by human effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: The Psalmist is the 'Receiver' of God's fidelity.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude; empowerment through divine gift rather than burden of duty.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic initiation of the 'Open Ear' leads to synergistic 'Walk and Talk'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's act (Soteriology) to man's response (Ethics) is logically bridged by the 'Open Ear' as a gift.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's freedom and the 'guarantee' of hope.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He drew me up from the desolate pit, out of the miry bog.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Open Ear' functions as the Spirit's work of enabling the Subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a 'pit' and 'bog' one cannot exit alone.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound, placing God as the Sender and Subject of the primary narrative, while the human response is a secondary program enabled by the Sender.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current emphasis on Pouvoir (the gift of the ear).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Walk' is always linked back to the 'Ear' so it doesn't drift into Devoir.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'miry bog' is well-defined, but the 'closed ear' could be more sharply contrasted with total spiritual deafness.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Emphasize that we cannot open our own ears.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To prevent the 'Open Ear' from being seen as a human achievement.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace' while still issuing a clear call to ethical action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'Talk/Walk' alliteration, semiotics reveals that the 'Open Ear' is the actual actantial pivot.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew 'Torah'; semiotics explains how 'Torah' functions as the Object of the secondary program.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model shows that the sermon avoids moralism by making the 'ability to obey' (Pouvoir) a gift from the Sender rather than a requirement of the Subject.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (inclined, heard, drew, set, put, multiplied)
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper-God' trap by making God the primary Subject of the rescue, not just the assistant to the Psalmist's effort.
